title: How to Get Grease Out of Jeans

steps.title: Tackle the stain right away.
steps.content: Tackle the stain right away. If you let the grease soak into your jeans or wash and/or dry your jeans just after you’ve gotten grease on them, removing the grease may become more challenging. To avoid letting the grease stain “set,” start removing it as soon as possible. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Dab up excess grease with a paper towel.
steps.content: Dab up excess grease with a paper towel. Fold a paper towel and dab at the grease so that the paper towel soaks up any excess grease sitting on the surface of your jeans. [2] X Expert Source Robert Shapiro Laundry Specialist Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. Removing what hasn’t soaked in can make the whole removal process easier. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Rinse your jeans in hot water.
steps.content: Rinse your jeans in hot water. Hot water works best for removing the oil from the stain. Run hot water in the sink or bathtub and hold your jeans underneath the water until the areas that are covered in grease are completely wet. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Scrub dish soap into the grease.
steps.content: Scrub dish soap into the grease. [5] X Expert Source Robert Shapiro Laundry Specialist Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. Squirt some dish soap onto the grease stains. Then, gently scrub it with a toothbrush for 2-3 minutes or until the grease appears to be gone. [6] X Research source If you don’t have dish soap, instead try using shampoo or laundry soap.

steps.title: Rinse your jeans again and hang them out to dry.
steps.content: Rinse your jeans again and hang them out to dry. [7] X Expert Source Robert Shapiro Laundry Specialist Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. Turn the sink or bathtub faucet back on and rinse the stained areas with hot water. Then, hang them out to dry on a clothesline or drying rack. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Use Pine Sol or Lestoil if you already use them for cleaning.
steps.content: Use Pine Sol or Lestoil if you already use them for cleaning. While these products are more commonly known as floor and furniture cleaners, they also work well as degreasers. Dab the grease stain with a cloth soaked in either Pine Sol or Lestoil and then throw your jeans into the washing machine. Hang them out to dry on a clothesline or drying rack once the cycle is done. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Soak up the grease with cornstarch.
steps.content: Soak up the grease with cornstarch. This is a good solution to try whether the grease stain is new or old. Lay your jeans on a flat surface and sprinkle cornstarch onto the grease stain until it’s completely covered. Then let it sit for at least an hour. Once the time is up, brush off the cornstarch with your hand and remove any residual powder with a damp sponge. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Try using WD-40 if you have it on hand.
steps.content: Try using WD-40 if you have it on hand. Spray WD-40 directly onto the grease and let it sit for 15-30 minutes. Then gently rub a small squirt of dish or laundry soap onto the affected area. Let the jeans sit for another 15-30 minutes, wash them in the washing machine, and let them air dry. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Try using mechanic soap if you work on cars.
steps.content: Try using mechanic soap if you work on cars. Mechanic soap is made specifically to clean up oil and grease. Apply the soap to the grease spots on your jeans and let it sit for 15-30 minutes. Then wash your jeans by themselves or with dirty rags in the washing machine. [12] X Research source Mechanic soap usually has a strong odor. Don’t throw your other clothes into the washing machine with your jeans, or else all of them may smell like the mechanic soap.

steps.title: Use hairspray or canned cheese if you’re in a hurry.
steps.content: Use hairspray or canned cheese if you’re in a hurry. Spray hairspray onto the grease-covered areas for several seconds or spray on canned cheese and smear it in. Then, wash your jeans in the washing machine and air dry them. Hairspray and canned cheese will both have an immediate effect on the stains, so there’s no need to let them sit for an extended period of time before washing. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Get the grease out with Coca-Cola for a homemade solution.
steps.content: Get the grease out with Coca-Cola for a homemade solution. Pour some coke onto the grease stains and then let it soak in for 1-2 hours. Once the time is up, wash your jeans in the washing machine and hang them up to dry. [14] X Research source Don’t give the coke longer than about 2 hours to soak in, or else the coke may stain your jeans.

steps.title: Remove the grease with aloe vera gel if you have some in your cabinet.
steps.content: Remove the grease with aloe vera gel if you have some in your cabinet. Soak your jeans in water for several minutes. Then scrub at the stains with aloe vera gel. Wash your jeans in the washing machine and then air dry them. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Soak up as much of the grease as you can with a paper towel.
steps.content: Soak up as much of the grease as you can with a paper towel. Dabbing at the excess can make the removal process a little easier. Take a paper towel and dab at the grease as soon as it gets on your jeans. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Pour sparkling water onto the grease.
steps.content: Pour sparkling water onto the grease. The carbonation of sparkling water makes it more effective than flat water in removing stains. Get a bottle or can of sparkling water and pour it all over the affected area. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Sprinkle coarse salt onto the grease and rub it in.
steps.content: Sprinkle coarse salt onto the grease and rub it in. Coarse salt acts as an abrasive, which can be useful for stain removal. Sprinkle the salt onto your jeans and use a paper towel to rub the salt over the grease stains. [18] X Research source Try using cornstarch or baking soda if you don’t have coarse salt. These may also act as abrasives that can soak up some of the grease.

steps.title: Add some soap and continue rubbing.
steps.content: Add some soap and continue rubbing. Squirt a little bit of dish soap, laundry soap, or even hand soap onto the grease stains. Continue using a paper towel to rub the stained spots. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Use a stain remover pen.
steps.content: Use a stain remover pen. Wipe off as much of the salt and soap as you can with a fresh paper towel. Then rub at whatever is left of the stain with a Tide-To-Go or Clorox Bleach pen. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Lay your jeans out to dry.
steps.content: Lay your jeans out to dry. Hang your jeans on a drying rack for a few hours so that they can dry completely. They may dry faster if you hang them on a clothesline when the sun is out. [21] X Research source
